result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry W T Cordle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 10:28 a.m.
Attorney Mary Brejcha in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Henry W T Cordle.  
Defendant Henry W T Cordle in court. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
30-DAYS JAIL STRAIGHT TIME
Sentence is to run Consecutive to Count 1 on 20CF1065..
Defendant is remanded into custody forthwith.

COSTS: $268.00 (Waived by the Court) 
DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (Waived by the Court)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
